subject: Technology
title: Samsung's Rise to the Top
description: A 60-second lesson on Samsung's Rise to the Top.

hook.text: Samsung started as a grocery trading company in 1938. Decades later, it would challenge Apple for the smartphone crown.

buildup.text: Samsung bet big on Android, launching the Galaxy S series in 2010 with larger screens than the iPhone.

discovery.text: Bigger screens were mocked at first. Then users realized they preferred watching video on a larger display.

twist.text: Apple sued Samsung for copying the iPhone's design. The patent war lasted seven years across four countries.

climax.text: Samsung now ships more phones than any other company. Size, variety, and price won the volume war.

punchline.text: A grocery company became the world's biggest phone maker.

quiz.question: What was Samsung before it made electronics?
